results.code:
673     @classmethod
674     def from_dict(
675         cls,
676         resource: "IRResource",
677         secret_name: str,
678         namespace: str,
679         source: str,
680         cert_data: Optional[Dict[str, Any]],
681         secret_type="kubernetes.io/tls",
682     ) -> Optional["SecretInfo"]:
683         """
684         Given a secret's name and namespace, and a dictionary of configuration elements, return
685         a SecretInfo for the secret.
686 
687         The "source" parameter needs some explanation. When working with secrets in most environments
688         where Ambassador runs, secrets will be loaded from some external system (e.g. Kubernetes),
689         and serialized to disk, and the disk serialization is the thing we can actually read the
690         dictionary of secret data from. The "source" parameter is the thing we read to get the actual
691         dictionary -- in our example above, "source" would be the pathname of the serialization on
692         disk, rather than the Kubernetes resource name.
693 
694         :param resource: owning IRResource
695         :param secret_name: name of secret
696         :param namespace: namespace of secret
697         :param source: source of data
698         :param cert_data: dictionary of secret info (public and private key, etc.)
699         :param secret_type: Kubernetes-style secret type
700         :return:
701         """
702         tls_crt = None
703         tls_key = None
704         user_key = None
705 
706         if not cert_data:
707             resource.ir.logger.error(
708                 f"{resource.kind} {resource.name}: found no certificate in {source}?"
709             )
710             return None
711 
712         if secret_type == "kubernetes.io/tls":
713             # OK, we have something to work with. Hopefully.
714             tls_crt = cert_data.get("tls.crt", None)
715 
716             if not tls_crt:
717                 # Having no public half is definitely an error. Having no private half given a public half
718                 # might be OK, though -- that's up to our caller to decide.
719                 resource.ir.logger.error(
720                     f"{resource.kind} {resource.name}: found data but no certificate in {source}?"
721                 )
722                 return None
723 
724             tls_key = cert_data.get("tls.key", None)
725         elif secret_type == "Opaque":
726             user_key = cert_data.get("user.key", None)
727 
728             if not user_key:
729                 # The opaque keys we support must have user.key, but will likely have nothing else.
730                 resource.ir.logger.error(
731                     f"{resource.kind} {resource.name}: found data but no user.key in {source}?"
732                 )
733                 return None
734 
735             cert = None
736         elif secret_type == "istio.io/key-and-cert":
737             resource.ir.logger.error(
738                 f"{resource.kind} {resource.name}: found data but handler for istio key not finished yet"
739             )
740 
741         return SecretInfo(
742             secret_name, namespace, secret_type, tls_crt=tls_crt, tls_key=tls_key, user_key=user_key
743         )
744
